Class FullScaleFreeGraph

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Graph
        |
        +--FullScaleFreeGraph
public class FullScaleFreeGraph
extends Graph

This Class constructs a full model BA (Barabasi and Albert) FullScale-Free graphs.

Field Summary
 int graphSeed
          In this variable is stored the seed number that feeds the random pseudogenerator and allows the creation of reproducible graphs.

Constructor Detail

FullScaleFreeGraph

public FullScaleFreeGraph(int numOfVertices,
                          int m,
                          int initialNodes,
                          int seed)
Creates a new instance of Custom Scale-Free by using as arguments the the maximum number of edges, the number of vertices-nodes the graph will have and the seed.
The algorithm works as follows:
1. If the number of edges is less than the predefined preferred number, select randomly a vertex and connect it with probability P(ki) = ki/Ójkj to the vertex i.
2. Repeat step 1
======= Creates a new instance of Full Scale-Free by using as arguments the number of vertices-nodes the graph will have, the seed the number oh initial nodes and the initial number of local connections of each node.
The algorithm is constituted by two major parts. For the first mo nodes:
1. Create a pool L of all nodes and a pool K with mo initial nodes
2. Remove randomly a node l from the pool L and connect it to a randomly chosen node from the pool K
3. Add node l to the pool K
And for the rest of the nodes, we follow closely the BA's algorithm
1. Remove randomly a node i from the pool L
2. Select randomly a vertex from the pool K and connect it with probability
* P(ki) = ki/Ójkj to the vertex i
3. Add i to the pool K.

public void check(int numOfVertices)
           throws java.io.IOException

printTopology

public void printTopology(int numOfVertices,
                          java.lang.String topologyFilePath)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Prints Graph Topology on a text file and is stored in the classpath defined by the topologyFilePath argument.
The integer argument numOfVertices is the number of vertices/nodes of the graph.

java.io.IOException
